alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Botetourt; City of Radford; Craig; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:44PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, Alleghany VA, Bedford, Botetourt, City of Radford, City of Roanoke, City of Salem, Craig, Floyd, Franklin, Giles, Montgomery, Pulaski and Roanoke and southeast West Virginia, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke, Blacksburg, Salem, Christiansburg, Radford, Pulaski and Vinton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

area.areaDesc: Bedford; Botetourt; City of Radford; Craig; Montgomery; Pulaski
